item.title: [HBASE-16570] Compute region locality in parallel at startup
item.summary: Compute region locality in parallel at startup

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

+            if (future != null) {

+              blockDistbn = future.get();

The future could be null? It seems that the asyncGetBlockDistribution always return one Object due to you catch all exceptions


+  public ListenableFuture<HDFSBlocksDistribution> asyncGetBlockDistribution(

+      HRegionInfo hri) {

+    try {

+      return loader.reload(hri, EMPTY_BLOCK_DISTRIBUTION);

+    } catch (Exception e) {

+      return Futures.immediateFuture(new HDFSBlocksDistribution());

+    }

+  }

By the way, {{new HDFSBlocksDistribution() }} could be replaced by EMPTY_BLOCK_DISTRIBUTION ?


 getTopBlockLocations(HRegionInfo region)

It could be removed, it seems no reference to the method.

Besides that, the patch looks good, could it accelerate the startup? Do you have some numbers about it?

The future could be null? It seems that the asyncGetBlockDistribution always return one Object due to you catch all exceptions

This will be null in TestBaseLoadBalancer#testClusterRegionLocations, because the RegionLocationFinder is mocked.


    // mock block locality for some regions

    RegionLocationFinder locationFinder = mock(RegionLocationFinder.class);

By the way, {{new HDFSBlocksDistribution() }} could be replaced by EMPTY_BLOCK_DISTRIBUTION ?

OK, will change it.

It could be removed, it seems no reference to the method.

Ok.

Besides that, the patch looks good, could it accelerate the startup? Do you have some numbers about it?

I do not test it, because this is complement for HBASE-14473.

if the future is not null, it seems you will make the code more clear, something like that. Could we modify the test case because it is just a test case? 


          HDFSBlocksDistribution blockDistbn = null;

          try {

            blockDistbn = future.get();

          } catch (InterruptedException | ExecutionException e) {

          } finally {

            if (blockDistbn == null) {

              blockDistbn = new HDFSBlocksDistribution();

            }

          }
Ok
v3 lgtm. Wait for QA

FAILURE: Integrated in Jenkins build HBase-Trunk_matrix #1569 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-Trunk_matrix/1569/)
HBASE-16570 Compute region locality in parallel at startup (binlijin) (chenheng: rev e11aafae957bc8d71cb622833011f29325049987)

  • (edit) hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/balancer/TestBaseLoadBalancer.java
  • (edit) hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/balancer/TestRegionLocationFinder.java
  • (edit) hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/balancer/BaseLoadBalancer.java
  • (edit) hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/balancer/RegionLocationFinder.java

If I'm reading this correctly, this change totally circumvents the block location cache that was added in HBASE-14473, and calls FileSystem.getFileBlockLocations() for every store file every time the balancer runs.

In the LoadBalancer.balanceCluster() implementations (in StochasticLoadBalancer, SimpleLoadBalancer), we create a new Cluster instance.

In Cluster.<init>, we call registerRegion() on every HRegionInfo.

In registerRegion(), we do the following:


        regionLocationFutures.set(regionIndex,

            regionFinder.asyncGetBlockDistribution(region));

Then, back in Cluster.<init> we do a get() on each ListenableFuture in a loop.

So while we are doing the calls to get block locations in parallel with 5 threads, it looks like we're recomputing them every time balanceCluster() is called and not taking advantage of the cache at all. Am I misreading something here? This seems to be a major performance regression for clusters with large numbers of regions/store files.
Reopen Gary Helmling? Revert from 1.3 in meantime.
I had opened a new JIRA, but yeah that's a better idea. I'll re-open here, revert from 1.3, and close out the new HBASE-16958 as a dupe.

I've reverted this from branch-1.3 for the moment, until the issue that I described can be addressed. I don't see where this would impact master startup time. If we need to pre-initialize this on startup, let's do it in a background thread only on startup. We need to make sure that locality is not recomputed on every run and that we use the cache instead.
can you check if the HBASE-16570_addnum.patch can fix this? Sorry for the mistake.
Wait for a moment.. I need to check it more.
Heng Chen Ted Yu Gary Helmling can you help review the patch HBASE-16570_addnum_v2.patch ?

So startup is only true for retainAssignment() ?

This should work.

Get a QA run (name patch with branch-1.3) ?

Yes, startup is only true for retainAssignment.
And the master/branch-1 all have the problem.
Why need a name patch with branch-1.3 ?

This was only reverted from branch-1.3

Try naming your patch 16570.branch-1.3-addendum.patch and get QA to test it.

Maybe a full patch with fix of the issue Gary mentioned for branch-1.3 and an addendum patch for master and branch-1?

I don't see where this would impact master startup time

And it seems some question to answer here binlijin
done

I don't see where this would impact master startup time

RegionLocationFinder.asyncGetBlockDistribution(HRegionInfo hri) only get a ListenableFuture<HDFSBlocksDistribution>,and submit task(get region's HDFSBlocksDistribution) to ListeningExecutorService and ListeningExecutorService run tasks concurrent, so there are 5 threads to get region's HDFSBlocksDistribution concurrently.

Revert "HBASE-16570 Compute region locality in parallel at startup (garyh: rev 1f4b1b350a9403650e748be2723dd35a4917c032)

  • (edit) hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/balancer/BaseLoadBalancer.java
  • (edit) hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/balancer/RegionLocationFinder.java

  • (edit) hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/balancer/TestBaseLoadBalancer.java
Makes sense. We can pick this up in 1.4 and 2.0

binlijin, thanks for putting together an addendum.

Yes, I understand that prior to this change, we were basically serializing the initialization of the cache.

Looking over your patch, the key area where the parallel initialization is needed is in BaseLoadBalancer.retainAssignment(), correct?

I think this would be cleaner if we refactor the original change and the addendum so that the cache refresh logic is abstracted in RegionLocationFinder. Currently we have RegionLocationFinder.asyncBlockDistribution() returning futures which Cluster.<init> is then waiting on, which seems like a bit of a bleeding of abstractions to me.

I'd propose that we:

  • add a RegionLocationFinder.refreshAndWait(Collection<HRegionInfo> hris) method. Internally, this can call asyncGetBlockDistribution(HRegionInfo) on each HRI and then loop through each of the futures and do a get()
  • make asyncGetBlockDistribution(HRegionInfo) private
  • add a boolean flag (as your addendum does) to BaseLoadBalancer.createCluster((List<ServerName> servers, Collection<HRegionInfo> regions, boolean forceRefresh)
  • if (forceRefresh == true) regionFinder.refreshAndWait(regions); before instantiating Cluster
  • pass true for the flag in the call in retainAssignments(), false elsewhere
  • revert the changes in Cluster to the version prior to this change originally going in

I think that would cover what you're trying to achieve here, with initially populating the cache in parallel when master starts up, and would better abstract the logic. Cluster.<init> would be free of any knowledge of this and the BalancerChore would simply run using the cache.

Let me know what you think or if I'm missing something.
Good idea, finish it in HBASE-16570_addnum_v3.patch, any more comment?

-1 overall

+1 on addendum v4. Thanks for the update, binlijin.

From our online usage we found at master startup the thread number might blow up simply because we're not limiting the maximum thread number of the executor used in RegionLocationFinder:


  RegionLocationFinder() {

    this.cache = createCache();

    executor = MoreExecutors.listeningDecorator(

        Executors.newScheduledThreadPool(

            5,

            new ThreadFactoryBuilder().

                setDaemon(true)

                .setNameFormat("region-location-%d")

                .build()));

  }

And since in patch here we will submit as many as region number tasks to get block locations, we should add some limit on thread number in parallel as well as preventing all threads starting at the same time (like use executor.schedule instead of executor.submit).

binlijin please upload fix of this issue as another addendum, thanks.

I'd suggest to give some clarification on the new changes and newly-added UT case in the new patch, including those points we discussed offline, so people here won't miss any information. Thanks. binlijin

The new added UT case is to make sure after RegionLocationFinder#refreshAndWait, regions's HDFSBlocksDistribution have cached in master's memory.
And change lastFullRefresh is to make HMaster start up faster when backup master becomes active master, we have encounter a longer startup(backup master becomes active master) which last 2.5 hours because namenode in high load, and after the change we only need less than 5 minutes.

  • private long lastFullRefresh = 0;
    + // Do not scheduleFullRefresh at master startup
    + private long lastFullRefresh = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
scheduleFullRefresh is only need when balance, so no need to call it at startup, we will call it when balance start.
Gary Helmling could you take a look at the new addendum patch and let us know your thoughts? Thanks.
+1 on addendum v7.

Thanks for review Gary Helmling, will commit in one day if no objections. And I think this should be an addendum for master branch and a completely new patch for 1.3.1 since already reverted for branch-1.3, right? Will create a sub-task targeting for 1.3.1 later and please upload the new patch there binlijin
See HBASE-17060 for 1.3.1

Pushed the addendum patch into branch-1 and master, closing this JIRA and please track HBASE-17060 for 1.3.1

Thanks binlijin for the addendum and thanks all for review.
